Sentencas: Phase composition, structural stability, electrical properties, thermochemical expansion and redox behavior of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 were assessed for potential application in solid oxide fuel cell anodes.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: XRD analysis confirms formation of single-phase perovskite-like Sr1-xPrxTiO3 +/-delta and Sr1-1.5xPrxTiO3 +/-delta (x = 0.02-0.30) ceramics under both oxidizing and reducing conditions, although microstructural studies indicate minor precipitation of TiO2 in reduced Sr-deficient ceramics with high Pr content.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: XPS analysis in combination with XRD suggests that Pr cations substitute into strontium sublattice in mixed 4+/3+ oxidation state and are essentially insoluble in titanium sublattice.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Reduction at elevated temperatures results in 2-3 orders of magnitude increase of n-type electronic conductivity with respect to oxidized materials.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Thermogravimetric and electrical studies demonstrate however very slow reduction kinetics at temperatures below 1273 K associated with nearly frozen equilibrium in cation sublattice and low oxygen vacancy concentration in oxidized materials.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: Electrical behavior is discussed in conjunction with defect chemistry of donor-doped strontium titanate.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode

Sentencas: All oxidized and reduced materials exhibit moderate thermal expansion coefficients, compatible with that of common solid electrolytes, and a small contribution of chemical expansion on reduction.
Titulo: Thermochemical behavior and transport properties of Pr-substituted SrTiO3 as potential solid oxide fuel cell anode
